name: orb
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
literary something in the shape of a ball: the glowing orb of the sun The creature's eyes opened, pale orbs muddled slightly with sleep.
a ball-shaped object with a cross on top of it, used as a symbol of royal power, and carried by a king or queen during some official ceremonies, together with a sceptre (= a decorated stick): He held the orb in one hand and in the other the sceptre.
More examplesFewer examplesA glowing orb streaked through the sky above their heads.Yellow orbs of melted butter were surrounded by the purple juice from cooked beets.A crown, orb and sceptre were taken from the Tower of London in 1671, but quickly returned.
